input: Canada Elects First Indigenous Prime Minister in Historic Vote. The landslide victory reshapes the country's political landscape and signals a generational shift among Canadian voters.

United Nations General Assembly Votes to Admit Palestine as Full Member State. The resolution passed with overwhelming support despite objections from a handful of nations, marking a historic diplomatic milestone.

Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal Allocates $60 Billion for Rural Broadband. Lawmakers hailed the agreement as a rare example of cross-party cooperation aimed at closing the digital divide in underserved communities.
Mexico's President Declares State of Emergency Over Cartel Violence. The move authorizes military deployment to five northern states and suspends certain civil liberties for 90 days.
Coco Gauff Defeats Iga Swiatek to Win First Wimbledon Title. The 22-year-old American rallied from a set down to claim her second Grand Slam championship on Centre Court.
NBA Announces Expansion Franchises in Las Vegas and Seattle. Both cities will begin play in the 2027-28 season, ending Seattle's 19-year absence from professional basketball.
Erling Haaland Scores Five Goals in Single Champions League Match. The Norwegian striker's historic performance propelled his club to a 6-1 quarterfinal victory and set a new tournament record.

Kenya's Kelvin Kiptum Breaks Two-Hour Marathon Barrier in Official Race. The 24-year-old clocked 1:59:38 at the Berlin Marathon, achieving what many considered the last great frontier in distance running.
Mozilla Launches Privacy-Focused Mobile Operating System. The open-source OS blocks all third-party trackers by default and gives users granular control over app permissions and data sharing.
Neuralink Patient Controls Robotic Arm Using Brain Implant for First Time. The paralyzed volunteer demonstrated the ability to grasp objects and type on a screen during a live demonstration.

Critical Vulnerability in Linux Kernel Exposes Millions of Servers Worldwide. The flaw allows remote code execution without authentication and affects kernel versions released over the past three years.

Autonomous Trucking Startup Completes First Coast-to-Coast Delivery Without Human Driver. The 2,800-mile route from Los Angeles to Jacksonville took 42 hours and used only highway-grade autonomous systems.
Pedro Almodóvar Wins Best Director at Golden Globes for English-Language Debut. The Spanish auteur's first film shot entirely in English earned four awards including Best Drama.
Kendrick Lamar and SZA Announce Joint Album and Co-Headlining Arena Tour. The collaboration has been teased for years and marks the first full-length project between the two TDE alumni.
Hulu's Limited Series on the Theranos Scandal Draws 45 Million Viewers in First Week. The show's lead actress is already generating early Emmy buzz for her portrayal of Elizabeth Holmes.
Cirque du Soleil Files for Bankruptcy Protection a Second Time. The entertainment company cited rising production costs and stagnant ticket sales as live event competition intensifies.
LVMH Reports Slower Luxury Goods Demand as Chinese Consumer Spending Weakens. The conglomerate's quarterly revenue missed estimates by 8%, dragging European luxury stocks down broadly.
Boeing and Airbus Post Dueling Record Order Books at Paris Air Show. Combined new orders exceeded $150 billion as airlines race to modernize fleets with more fuel-efficient aircraft.
U.S. Housing Starts Fall to Lowest Level in Three Years. Builders pulled back as elevated mortgage rates and high material costs squeezed profit margins on new single-family homes.
Kroger-Albertsons Merger Blocked by Federal Judge on Antitrust Grounds. The ruling cited potential harm to consumers through reduced competition in grocery pricing across 48 overlapping markets.
League of Legends World Championship Draws 120 Million Peak Viewers. The esports event surpassed last year's viewership by 30%, with the grand final held at a sold-out stadium in Riyadh.
Rivian IPO Raises $15 Billion in Largest Tech Listing of the Year. The electric vehicle maker's shares surged 40% on debut as investors bet on its commercial fleet contracts with Amazon.

Documentary on Snowden Surveillance Leaks Sparks Renewed Congressional Debate. The Oscar-shortlisted film reignited calls for reform of government surveillance programs and drew sharp reactions from both parties.

Pro Gamer Signs $25 Million Contract With Esports Organization, Largest in History. The deal includes streaming rights and merchandise revenue, rivaling contracts seen in traditional professional sports leagues.

Stripe Confidentially Files for IPO Valued at $95 Billion. The payments technology giant's public listing is expected to be the largest for a venture-backed company and a bellwether for the fintech sector.
